column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column35: Brenda J. Spiegler, Frank C. Worrell, Barbara Kapetanakes, Ananda Amstadter, Charles B. Nemeroff, Daniel Krauss, Lisa Danylchuk
column36:
Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

Please remove Dr. Hughes from your organization, up to and including voiding her membership and revoking any title/certification she has been offered by your organization, so that she cannot continue to abuse her position and to stop any further harm she may potentially cause in cases such as the aforementioned one.

column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here
column35: Brenda J. Spiegler, Frank C. Worrell, Barbara Kapetanakes, Ananda Amstadter, Charles B. Nemeroff, Daniel Krauss, Lisa Danylchuk

She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

Please remove Dr. Hughes from your organization, up to and including voiding her membership and revoking any title/certification she has been offered by your organization, so that she cannot continue to abuse her position and to stop any further harm she may potentially cause in cases such as the aforementioned one.

column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here
column35: Brenda J. Spiegler, Frank C. Worrell, Barbara Kapetanakes, Ananda Amstadter, Charles B. Nemeroff, Daniel Krauss, Lisa Danylchuk
column36:

In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

Please remove Dr. Hughes from your organization, up to and including voiding her membership and revoking any title/certification she has been offered by your organization, so that she cannot continue to abuse her position and to stop any further harm she may potentially cause in cases such as the aforementioned one.

She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

Please remove Dr. Hughes from your organization, up to and including voiding her membership and revoking any title/certification she has been offered by your organization, so that she cannot continue to abuse her position and to stop any further harm she may potentially cause in cases such as the aforementioned one.

column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column2: Its obvious after only a very short time that Dawn Hughes believes only men can commit ipv against women (or another man if in a homosexual relationship).  Women are apparently excluded from any possibility of this solely because of their gender.  The longer I listened to her the more convinced I became the she is more than biased, and any so called "expert" opinion she has offered should at minimum be questioned, if not set aside completely. I hope no one is or has been jailed because of her testimony.  And I hope more any patients she has had have not been negatively affected, but I can't see how that could be remotely possible.
column26: Remove Dr. Dawn Hughes' From Psychological Organizations
column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column2: After being forced to watch this hostile, unethical and unprofessional individual testify under oath, I cannot imagine her providing treatment or opinions on any domestic violence issue. As an IPV survivor, her well compensated lies have triggered my own PTSD. Her lack of knowledge in utilizing even simple forms to diagnose Amber Heard shows that she should never be able to provide her “for sale” opinions again.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column2:
I AM A VICTIM OF REAL LIFE MAJOR PTSD DEPRESSION AND NOT MADE UP INCIDENTS IN WHICH #AMBERHEARD HAS MADE-UP AND INTENTIONALLY 
 FALSELY TESTIFIED TO IN COURT, I DIDN'T KNOW THIS  COURT BATTLE WAS GOING ON BECAUSE I DONT WATCH CERTAIN CHANNELS DUE TO MY PTSD NIGHTMARES AND THE HORRIBLE EVERYDAY SYMPTOMS I STRUGGLE WITH EVERY SINGLE SECOND OF EACH DAY, I TRIED TAKING MY OWN LIFE 4 TIMES BECAUSE I JUST WANTED THE NIGHTMARES TO STOP IF IT MEANT TAKING MY OWN LIFE BUT MY HUSBAND KEPT CALLING 911 TO EITHER REVIVE ME OR STITCH ME UP, THEN I WAS ORDERED IMMEDIATELY BY SERVERAL SHERIFFS AND JUDGES TO A MENTAL ILLNESS HOSPITAL FOR MY SUICIDAL ATTEMPTS , I HAVE BEEN HOSPITALIZED ALREADY 13 TIMES EACH TIME FOR 3 WEEKS AND HAVE BEEN ON SERVERAL DIFFERENT HIGH DOSE MEDICATIONS, FOR ALMOST 3 DECADES, IT TOOK ME 2 DECADES TO FULLY UNDERSTAND WHAT MAJOR PTSD DEPRESSION WAS, I JUST KNEW I COULD TALK ABOUT MY TRAUMA WITHOUT CRYING UNCONTROLLABLY AND SHAKING LIKE A LEAF, I WAS IN SHOCK FOR THE FIRST 2 1/2 YEARS THEN THE NIGHTMARES SLOWLY STARTED, I WAS AT WORK WHEN ALL THE SUDDEN MY HEART STARTED POUNDING, MY HANDS WERE SHAKING, I COULDN'T SEE STRAIGHT AS IF MY EYES WERE BOUNCING UP AND DOWN INSIDE MY HEAD, I FELT LIKE I WAS FLOATING AND NOT IN MY OWN BODY, I FELT SOO SCARED BECAUSE I HAD NO IDEA WHAT WAS HAPPENING TO ME WHEN ALL THE SUDDEN MY THROAT CHOAKED-UP AND I BEGAN CRYING UNCONTROLLABLY THEN MY CO-WORKER CAME UP TO ME AND ASKED ME WHAT WAS WRONG AND I ANSWERED I DON'T KNOW WHATS HAPPENING TO ME, I HAVE NEVER FELT THIS WAY BEFORE THEN JULES ASKED ME HOW I WAS FEELING AND I TOLD HER, JULES IMMEDIATELY SAID OMG ! I HOPE IT'S NOT WHAT I THINK IT IS AND I ASKED JULES WHAT DO YOU THINK IT IS JULES THEN EXPLAINED ABOUT THE SAME SYMPTOMS A FRIEND OF HERS HAD WHICH TURNED OUT TO BE A PANIC ATTACK, I ASK JULES WHAT IS A PANIC ATTACK AND WHAT DO I DO ? 
JULES ANSWERED THE BEST THING YOU CAN DO IS GO HOME BEFORE YOU CAN'T DRIVE HOME SO TELL THE MANAGER HOW YOU FEEL AND I WILL FINISH YOUR JOB, AS I WAS DRIVING I COULDN'T HARDLY CONSENTRATE OR FOCUS ON THE ROAD, THEN I CALLED MY BABY DAUGHTER'S GOD MOTHER AND EXPLAINED AND SHE TOLD ME THAT I WAS NOT THE TYPE TO COMPLAIN AND WHEN I DO SOMETHING MUST BE TRUELY WRONG, SO PATRICIA INSISTED ON COMING OVER AND TAKING ME TO SEE A DOCTOR, THAT WAS WHEN THE DOCTOR IMMEDIATELY DIAGNOSED ME WITH MAJOR PTSD DEPRESSION THEN I WAS SENT TO MHDD FOR MEDICATIONS AND COUNSELING SESSIONS, WITH PTSD SYMPTOMS ON A DAILY BASICS AND STRUGGLES ECT. I SERVERAL TIMES LOST MY CONSENTRATION DRIVING AND FROZE WHILE ALSO STOPPING MY CAR IN THE MIDDLE OF A 4 LANE HIGHWAY AND HAD MY LICENSE TAKEN AWAY BY THE MEDICAL BOARD TILL THE VERY DAY PLUS MY PRIMARY DOCTOR AND SOCIAL SECURITY DEEMED ME PERMANENTLY DISABLED BECAUSE MY SYMPTOMS ARE SO SEVERE I COULD NOT BE DEPENDABLE AT WORK ANYMORE, COUNSELORS TOLD ME I NEEDED A SERVICE ANIMAL AT ALL TIMES AND IF IT WASN'T FOR MY SERVICE ANIMAL AND ALL MY MEDICATIONS I WOULDN'T BE ALIVE TODAY, I HAVE ONLY SEEN ABOT A WEEK AND A HALF OF COURT TV AND I CAN DEFINITELY SAY 100% THAT #AMBERHEARDISALIAR AND DOES NOT HAVE PTSD DEPRESSION BECAUSE WITH PTSD EVEN RAISING CHILDREN IS IMPOSSIBLE ESPECIALLY A BABY, I HAD TO HAVE SOMEONE ELSE HELP ME RAISE MY OLDER CHILDREN AND IT WAS HARD FOR ME TO LET THEM GO BUT I WAS IN NO CONDITION TO TAKE CARE OF MYSELF AND HOW COULD I CARE TAKE OF MY OWN CHILDREN WHEN THEY WERE TOO YOUNG TO UNDERSTAND MY MENTAL ILLNESS WHEN I DIDN'T EVEN UNDERSTAND IT MYSELF WHEN I WAS DIAGNOSED WITH PTSD, IT IS SOMETHING THAT TOOK ME DECADES TO REALIZE WHAT IT WAS AND THAT IT IS A SERIOUS CRIPPLING AND DISABLING MENTAL ILLNESS THAT GIVE YOU AGORAPHOBIA, ANXIETY, NIGHTMARES, FEAR, INSOMNIA, HYGIENE ISSUES, NO ENERGY, LACK OF CONCENTRATION, LOSS OF APPETITE, UNABLE TO DRIVE A VEHICLE ECT. I TAKE THE UBER. ROWENA ALVARADO,  KYLE TEXAS

She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

Please remove Dr. Hughes from your organization, up to and including voiding her membership and revoking any title/certification she has been offered by your organization, so that she cannot continue to abuse her position and to stop any further harm she may potentially cause in cases such as the aforementioned one.

column229: President, American Board of Professional Psychology

column2:
She did not operate under the standards of a forensic (Not clinical) counseling professional. She abandoned protocol in standardized testing practices, forensic practices, and ethics (through bias and misrepresentation of the purpose and use of assessments). 
She is an embarrassment to the field of professional psychology and mental health.
column26: Remove Dr. Dawn Hughes' From Psychological Organizations
column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column192: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column229: President, American Board of Professional Psychology

column2: Agreed she is very unprofessional, speaks as though she was in the room and is an eye witness. As an abuse survivor (childhood not dv) and a multiple rape survivor this Dr triggered me. Too much emotion too much emphasis on her own personal opinion. I've been to therapists and doctors like her. Where they tell you your wrong because they feel otherwise about your own mental health. I got that same immediate sick feeling in my stomach when I would tell the Drs how bad the abuse was at home and they would refuse to believe me because my parents would say other wise and well I was just a child so I must have been mistaken. Within 2 minutes of her taking the stand the first time, that scarred little girl in me got the old familiar fight or flight feeling from this woman. She's one that will make you fit her narrative about you instead of listening to you. Then just throw a bunch of drugs down your throat and call it a day.

column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here
column35: Brenda J. Spiegler, Frank C. Worrell, Barbara Kapetanakes, Ananda Amstadter, Charles B. Nemeroff, Daniel Krauss, Lisa Danylchuk

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

Please remove Dr. Hughes from your organization, up to and including voiding her membership and revoking any title/certification she has been offered by your organization, so that she cannot continue to abuse her position and to stop any further harm she may potentially cause in cases such as the aforementioned one.

In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

Please remove Dr. Hughes from your organization, up to and including voiding her membership and revoking any title/certification she has been offered by your organization, so that she cannot continue to abuse her position and to stop any further harm she may potentially cause in cases such as the aforementioned one.

column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

Please remove Dr. Hughes from your organization, up to and including voiding her membership and revoking any title/certification she has been offered by your organization, so that she cannot continue to abuse her position and to stop any further harm she may potentially cause in cases such as the aforementioned one.

column2: I’m a clinical psychologist and expert witness - this woman is unethical and damaging to our profession.
column26: Remove Dr. Dawn Hughes' From Psychological Organizations
column33: Dr. Dawn Hughes' behavior in trial was biased and unethical. Sign now to show your support!
column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes is listed on her website as specializing in "Interpersonal Violence

  • Adult Survivors of Childhood Abuse (Physical/Sexual/Emotional)
  • Intimate Partner Violence (Domestic Violence)
  • Rape and Sexual Assault
  • Physical Assault, Mugging, Violent Crime
  • Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Complex Trauma and Complex PTSD"

Under that guise she is certified by the American Board of Professional Psychology as a Forensic Psychologist. Her actions and testimony do NOT align with the certification and position she holds.

Videos of the trial are all over YouTube, but the footage I watched of Dr. Hughes' testimony prior to starting this petition (full coverage excluding breaks and sidebar conversation) is day 13 (direct examination) https://youtu.be/ETCkYAh1my8 and day 14 (cross examination) https://youtu.be/Az_KJBowdX4

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

No matter who you support, I think it is clear that Dr. Hughes is abusing her position in a highly unethical manner bordering on malpractice.

Please sign this petition to remove her from any psychological organization she is associated with and end her engagement in the judicial process, so we can put a stop to her unethical behavior.

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here

P.S. if you haven't already signed please check out my petition to do the same with Dr. David Spiegel: Click Here
column35: Brenda J. Spiegler, Frank C. Worrell, Barbara Kapetanakes, Ananda Amstadter, Charles B. Nemeroff, Daniel Krauss, Lisa Danylchuk
column36:
Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard. She all but admitted to determining that Ms. Heard suffers from PTSD and was a victim to IPV prior to examination of the facts and administration of psychometric testing, poisoning any conclusions or results from her evaluation or testing of Ms. Heard. In making that decision Dr. Hughes showed clear disregard and reckless abandon for her profession, the field she represents, and the justice system she serves in her role as a Forensic Psychologist.

Dr. Hughes' actions prior to her testimony alone show extreme and unethical bias, but perhaps even more telling is her impassioned description of Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard as if she witnessed these alleged events herself, as if these allegations are undisputable facts. She did not witness anything that happened between Mr. Depp and Ms. Heard prior to these proceedings, did not perform an evaluation of Mr. Depp (has never even met Mr. Depp according to her testimony during cross examination), and yet somehow concluded in her "professional" opinion that Mr. Depp perpetrated Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) against Ms. Heard.

In her testimony Dr. Hughes said she had reviewed evidence in the course of her evaluation (including audio files, text messages, and photographs), and despite contradictory evidence that Ms. Heard in fact perpetrated acts of abuse on Mr. Depp, Dr. Hughes testified that she did not believe Mr. Depp was a victim of IPV perpetrated by Ms. Heard, and that Ms. Heard's alleged violence towards Mr. Depp was only a reaction to Mr. Depp's alleged abuse of Ms. Heard (however during cross examination Dr. Hughes did testify that on a couple occasions where Ms. Heard was alleged to be the aggressor, "if true" Ms. Heard was not perpetrating reactive violence).

Please remove Dr. Hughes from your organization, up to and including voiding her membership and revoking any title/certification she has been offered by your organization, so that she cannot continue to abuse her position and to stop any further harm she may potentially cause in cases such as the aforementioned one.

column34:
According to her own website (drdawnhughes.com), "Dawn M. Hughes, Ph.D., ABPP is a clinical and forensic psychologist in New York City who specializes in the assessment and treatment of interpersonal violence, traumatic stress and the anxiety disorders."

Dr. Hughes gave testimony in the Depp vs. Heard defamation case on May 3rd and 4th 2022. She was retained as a expert witness by the Woods Rogers law firm on behalf of their client Amber Heard. In her testimony, she showed obvious and inappropriate bias towards Ms. Heard.
